thread.title: Gardener 'on the run after having sex with a client's dog' has been found | Metro News
thread.title_full: Gardener 'on the run after having sex with a client's dog' has been found | Metro News

author: Jen Mills For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Gardener 'on the run after having sex with a client's dog' has been found | Metro News

organizations.name: gwinnett county sheriff’s office in america

text:
Jen Mills for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 14 Feb 2017 9:47 pm There was a manhunt for Cruz Barrera Lugo (Picture: Gwinnet County Police) 
A gardener who ‘went on the run’ after he was allegedly caught having sex with his client’s dog has handed himself in. 
Cruz Barrera Lugo, 61, is said to have stopped having sex with the pet when the homeowners arrived and he realised he had been spotted. Petition to have Donald Trump impeached has nearly 1,000,000 signatures 
He then fled in his black pick-up truck, police said. 
Officers launched a manhunt for the landscape gardener, whose abuse of the animal was said to be caught on CCTV. The search was reported internationally. 
However, Berreralugo handed himself in on February 14 and is now in custody at Gwinnett County Sheriff’s Office in America, the Atlanta Journal reports .
